title: Roxburgh's Common Skin Diseases 18th Edition
description:
Common Skin Diseases, 18th Edition (18th Edition)
by Ronald Marks
Paperback, 320 Pages, Published 2011

ISBN-10: 0-340-98350-7 / 0340983507
ISBN-13: 978-0-340-98350-8 / 9780340983508

BY Ronald Marks BSc (Hons), MB, BS(Hons), FRCP, FRCPath, Emeritus Professor, Cardiff, UK AND
Richard Motley MA, MD, FRCP, Welsh Institute of Dermatology, University Hospital of Wales, Cardiff, UK
Hardcover: 384 pages
Publisher: CRC Press; 18 edition (September 30, 2011)
Language: English

The 18th edition of this classic dermatology book, formerly published as Roxburgh's Common Skin Diseases, has been thoroughly revised and updated and continues to be an essential core text for the busy general practitioner and the dermatology trainee. Presented in a colourful, reader-friendly way with over 400 detailed illustrations, the text presents a succinct account of the subject, starting with the basic science and then moving through clinical manifestations, diagnostic techniques, treatment and clinical management of the most common skin disorders. Concise text, key point boxes and chapter summaries will help medical students with their all-important exam revision. More comprehensive, and written at a modern diagnostic level with techniques and surgical treatments, the book retains all the features that have made previous editions so successful: numerous colour illustrations, clear down to earth style, rapid access to information, real-life case studies and invaluable chapter summaries.
